sentences.english: Runner-up of Dutch National Cup in 2003.
Team members receive the 1st Runner-up trophy.
sentences.chinese: 辩论队队员一同接受亚军殊荣。

sentences.english: Get your feed-water as clean as you can to improve the longevity of the runner.
sentences.chinese: 找最干净的您给水你可以提高亚军长寿。

sentences.english: World Table Tennis Team F runner-up group.
sentences.chinese: 世乒赛团体赛女团亚军。

sentences.english: Our team finished second with four wins, two defeats and one tie.
sentences.chinese: 我队以四胜两负一平的成绩获得亚军。

sentences.english: Were they just a runner-up in the game show "Happily Ever After"?
sentences.chinese: 他们只是游戏秀“从此幸福”里面的亚军吗？

sentences.english: Hao Yajun learned that truth, visiting Leon, blame YuWei dont protect hao beauty.
sentences.chinese: 郝亚军得知真相，探望李昂，责怪喻威不保护郝丽人。

sentences.english: This gave me some experience and hopefully, I won’t be a runner-up much longer.
sentences.chinese: 它会给我经验，使我有希望不再成为亚军。

sentences.english: You can find charts outlining the class winners, as well as the runners-up, in the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 你可以找到图表概述级冠军，以及亚军，在旁听席上。

sentences.english: Her compatriot female apprentice outstanding Pu the Coss lid takes the second place.
sentences.chinese: 她的同胞师姐杰普科斯盖获得亚军。

sentences.english: Third was Rafa's reported half-time team-talk with 15 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 第三名是拉法中场的球队演说拿到15%而获得亚军。

sentences.english: The British team came in second.
The Chinese workers ranked second were the only group named.
sentences.chinese: 中国农民工位居亚军，是唯一上榜的群体。

sentences.english: Chengdu and Chongqing of China win the first two places.
sentences.chinese: 其中中国城市成都和重庆分别摘得冠亚军。

sentences.english: He joined the Cub Scouts and placed second in the fifth grade spelling bee.
sentences.chinese: 他参加童子军，在五年级的时候获得拼字比赛亚军。

sentences.english: For a full list of Agency of the Year winners and runners-up, see here.
sentences.chinese: 点击此处查看年度机构奖冠亚军的完整名单。

definition: to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
